title: css-variables-frame-range
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="var-in-frame-range">Var-In-Frame-Range</h1> <p>The purpose of this library is to provide a way to specify a range for an element and and apply a result to its css properties, based on whether on not the value of an independent variable is within the specified range.</p> <p><code>--in-frame-range</code>, represents whether or not the <code>--frame-current</code> is within the range of an element, as defined by custome properties <code>--frame-min</code> and <code>--frame-max</code>.</p> <p>A goal of this library to minimize the use of javascript. Once the initial</p> <h2 id="usage">Usage</h2> <h3 id="setup">Setup</h3> <ul> <li>Import <code>./index.css</code> (or <code>./inclusive.css</code>) containing the <code>var--in-frame-range</code> class.</li> <li>Give any elements you wish to control said class.</li> <li>Provide a <code>--frame-current</code> custom property to the parent of said elements.</li> <li>Provide <code>--frame-min</code> and <code>--frame-max</code> variables to each of element (Set <code>--frame-max</code> &gt; <code>--frame-min</code>)</li> <li>Use the calculated <code>--in-frame-range</code> and <code>--not-in-frame-range</code> custom properties to control other css properties (e.g. <code>opacity:var(--in-frame-range)</code>)</li> <li><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleDeclaration/setProperty">Use javascript</a> to adjust the value of the <code>--frame-current</code> custom property.</li> </ul> <h3 id="value">Value</h3> <p>If <code>--frame-current</code> is within the range defined by <code>--frame-min</code> and <code>--frame-max</code>, its value is 1, and 0 otherwise.</p> <p>Because <code>--in-frame-range</code> is an integer, many properties (e.g. <code>visibility</code>, <code>display</code>) <em>cannot</em> be manipulated as they require values other than 0 and 1.</p> <p><code>visibility</code> can be emulated by passing the <code>--in-frame-range</code> value to <code>opacity</code>, as this takes an integer between 0 and 1.</p> <p>Additionally, one can move objects on and off screen by manipulating the value of <code>--in-frame-range</code> to control the (absolute) position of an element.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode css"><code class="sourceCode css"><span class="im">@import</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.css&quot;</span>; <span class="in">:</span>has(<span class="fu">.var--in-frame-range</span>) { <span class="co">/* This syntax is used to refer to the parent element.</span> <span class="co"> It is not currently supporated in any major browser.</span> <span class="co"> https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/:has</span> <span class="co"> */</span> <span class="kw">position</span>: <span class="dv">relative</span>; --frame-current: <span class="dv">0</span>; } <span class="fu">.var--in-frame-range</span> { <span class="kw">position</span>: <span class="dv">absolute</span>; <span class="kw">opacity</span>: var(--in-frame-range); <span class="kw">top</span>: calc(var(--not-in-frame-range) _index.html bash build.sh config css demos.md html js jsconfig.json links-to-html.lua package-lock.json package.json package.old.json readme.md script.sh scripts search.html templates test.json todo.md ts vendor <span class="dv">100vh</span>); <span class="kw">transition</span>: opacity <span class="dv">0.25s</span>, <span class="dv">top</span> <span class="dv">0.25s</span>; } <span class="fu">.item-1</span> { --frame-min: <span class="dv">0</span>; --frame-max: <span class="dv">3</span>; } <span class="fu">.item-1</span><span class="in">:before</span> { <span class="kw">content</span>: <span class="st">&quot;I&#39;m show up when --frame-current has a value between 0 and 3&quot;</span>; } <span class="fu">.item-2</span> { --frame-min: <span class="dv">4</span>; --frame-max: <span class="dv">7</span>; } <span class="fu">.item-2</span><span class="in">:before</span> { <span class="kw">content</span>: <span class="st">&quot;I&#39;m show up when --frame-current has a value between 4 and 7&quot;</span>; }</code></pre></div> <h3 id="other-values">Other Values</h3> <h3 id="inverse">Inverse</h3> <p>For convinience, the library also provides a custom property, <code>--not-in-frame-range</code> as the inverse of <code>--in-frame-range</code>.</p> <h4 id="exlclusion">Exlclusion</h4> <p>Importing <code>./exclusive.css</code> gives access to the <code>var--in-frame-range_exclusive</code> class. It provides the custom properties <code>--in-frame-range_exclusive</code> and <code>--not-in-frame-range_exclusive</code>, which function like the others, but with the bounds of the range excluded.</p> </body> </html>

title: universa-border-debug
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="universal-border-debug">Universal Border Debug</h1> <p>CSS debugging tool color borders red, green, or blue.</p> <p>This is useful for visual debugging and should not be used in production code.</p> <p>Usage:</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;link</span><span class="ot"> rel=</span><span class="st">&quot;stylesheet&quot;</span><span class="ot"> href=</span><span class="st">&quot;../universal-border-debug/0.0.0/red.css&quot;</span> <span class="kw">/&gt;</span> <span class="co">&lt;!-- OR --&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;link</span><span class="ot"> rel=</span><span class="st">&quot;stylesheet&quot;</span><span class="ot"> href=</span><span class="st">&quot;../universal-border-debug/0.0.0/green.css&quot;</span> <span class="kw">/&gt;</span> <span class="co">&lt;!-- OR --&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;link</span><span class="ot"> rel=</span><span class="st">&quot;stylesheet&quot;</span><span class="ot"> href=</span><span class="st">&quot;../universal-border-debug/0.0.0/blue.css&quot;</span> <span class="kw">/&gt;</span></code></pre></div> </body> </html>

title: universal-no-margins
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="universal-no-margins">Universal No Margins</h1> <p>CSS utility that removes all margins from the page.</p> <p>See <a href="https://mxstbr.com/thoughts/margin/">Margin considered harmful</a>.</p> <p>Usage:</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;link</span><span class="ot"> rel=</span><span class="st">&quot;stylesheet&quot;</span><span class="ot"> href=</span><span class="st">&quot;../universal-no-margins/0.0.0/index.css&quot;</span> <span class="kw">/&gt;</span></code></pre></div> </body> </html>

title: hide-n-show
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="hide-n-show">Hide-N-Show</h1> <p>CSS Utilities to control visibility of elements</p> <h2 id="landscape.css">/landscape.css</h2> <p>Utility classes to hide elements that had an element, unless the viewport is in landscape mode.</p> <p>This is useful to &quot;progressively enhance&quot; mobile-first applications.</p> <p>Usage:</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;link</span><span class="ot"> rel=</span><span class="st">&quot;stylesheet&quot;</span><span class="ot"> href=</span><span class="st">&quot;../hide-n-show/0.0.0/landscape.css&quot;</span> <span class="kw">/&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;nav&gt;</span> Always Visible <span class="kw">&lt;span</span><span class="ot"> class=</span><span class="st">&quot;hide-n-show-landscape&quot;</span><span class="kw">&gt;</span> [Only visible in landscape mode] <span class="kw">&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;/nav&gt;</span></code></pre></div> <p>Control visible display property by using <code>hide-n-show-landscape-&lt;display value&gt;</code></p> <p>Values supported:</p> <ul> <li>block</li> <li>flex</li> <li>grid</li> <li>inline</li> <li>inline-block</li> <li>inline-flex</li> <li>inline-grid</li> </ul> </body> </html>

title: setBackoff
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="timers">Timers</h1> <h2 id="setintervalwait">setIntervalWait</h2> <p><code>setIntervalWait</code> has a similar API to set the built-in <code>setInterval</code> function, but it waits for the previous instance callback to be completed before calling the next. Additonally <code>clearIntervalWait</code> returns true if the id exists, and false if it does not.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> setInterval<span class="op">,</span> <span class="op">{</span> clear <span class="im">as</span> cleaIntervalWait<span class="op">,</span> <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./set-interval-wait.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> id <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">setInterval</span>(() <span class="op">=&gt;</span> <span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">/* function that must finish */</span> <span class="op">},</span> <span class="dv">100</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="at">setTimeout</span>(() <span class="op">=&gt;</span> <span class="at">clearIntervalWait</span>(id)<span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">2000</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="setretry">setRetry</h2> <p><code>setRetry</code> has a similar API to set the built-in <code>setTimeout</code> and <code>setInterval</code> functions. The difference is that it will retry the callback if it fails (throws an error) at constant intervals.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> setRetry<span class="op">,</span> <span class="op">{</span> clear <span class="im">as</span> clearRetry <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./set-retry.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> id <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">setRetry</span>(() <span class="op">=&gt;</span> <span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">/* function that may throw an error */</span> <span class="op">},</span> <span class="dv">100</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="setbackoff">setBackoff</h2> <p><code>setRetry</code> has a similar API <code>setRetry</code>. The difference is that it will retry the callback if it fails (throws an error) at exponentially increasing intervals intervals.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> setBackoff<span class="op">,</span> <span class="op">{</span> clear <span class="im">as</span> clearBackoff <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./set-retry.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> id <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">setBackoff</span>(() <span class="op">=&gt;</span> <span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">/* function that may throw an error */</span> <span class="op">},</span> <span class="dv">100</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="asynctimeout">asyncTimeout</h2> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> setTimeoutAsync <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./set-timeout-async.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> await <span class="at">setTimeoutAsync</span>((arg) <span class="op">=&gt;</span> arg<span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">100</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;hello&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="asyncretryasync">asyncRetryAsync</h2> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> setRetryAsync <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./set-retry-async.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> await <span class="at">setRetryAsync</span>((arg) <span class="op">=&gt;</span> arg<span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">100</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;hello&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="asyncbackoffasync">asyncBackoffAsync</h2> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> setBackoffAsync <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./set-backoff-async.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> await <span class="at">setBackoffAsync</span>((arg) <span class="op">=&gt;</span> arg<span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">100</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;hello&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> </body> </html>

title: setIntervalPatient
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h2 id="setintervalpatient">setIntervalPatient</h2> <p><code>setIntervalPatient</code> has a similar API to set the built-in <code>setIntervalPatient</code> function, but it waits for the previous instance callback to be completed before calling the next.</p> <p>Additonally <code>clearIntervalPatient</code> returns true if the id exists, and false if it does not.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> setIntervalPatient<span class="op">,</span> <span class="op">{</span> clear <span class="im">as</span> clearIntervalPatient <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;..&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> id <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">setIntervalPatient</span>(() <span class="op">=&gt;</span> <span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">/* function that must finish */</span> <span class="op">},</span> <span class="dv">100</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="at">setTimeout</span>(() <span class="op">=&gt;</span> <span class="at">clearIntervalPatient</span>(id)<span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">2000</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> </body> </html>

Is the part of the specificaion? See: js/define-component-by-tag/0.0.0/</p> <h2 id="usage">Usage</h2> </body> </html>

title: negatablestring
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="negatable-strings">Negatable Strings</h1> <p>Ever wanted to literally subtract a string from another in your code? Eh,... didn't thinks so...</p> <p>But here's library that let's do that and then some!</p> <h2 id="api">API</h2> <h3 id="string.prototype">String.prototype;</h3> <p>Import the string polyfill to use library with regular strings.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="st">&quot;./string-prototype.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="scale">scale;</h3> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> scale <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <p>The <em>scale</em> function transfroms a string into a negatable string object.</p> <p>By default, the string representations are the same.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="st">&quot;string&quot;</span> <span class="op">===</span> <span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;string&quot;</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>()<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <p>Negative one (-1) can be passed as a second parameter to get a negated version of the given string&quot;</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="st">&quot;string&quot;</span> <span class="op">===</span> <span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;string&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">-1</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>().<span class="at">split</span>(<span class="st">&quot;&quot;</span>).<span class="at">reverse</span>().<span class="at">join</span>(<span class="st">&quot;&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="negatablestring.prototype.tostring">NegatableString.prototype.toString();</h3> <p>By default, the string representation is simply the representation of the given string backwards.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;string&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">-1</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>())<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">// logs &quot;rts&quot;</span></code></pre></div> <p>But this is not the full story. Negative characters chan be highlighted by passing a prefix parameter to <em>toString</em> method</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;string&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">-1</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>(<span class="st">&quot;~&quot;</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">// logs &quot;~r~t~s&quot;</span></code></pre></div> <p>Prefixes and suffixes can be added for both &quot;negative&quot; and &quot;positive&quot; characters</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="kw">const</span> nPrefix <span class="op">=</span> <span class="st">&#39;&lt;span class=&quot;positive&quot;&gt;&#39;</span><span class="op">:</span> <span class="kw">const</span> pPrefix <span class="op">=</span> <span class="st">&#39;&lt;span class=&quot;negative&quot;&gt;&#39;</span><span class="op">:</span> <span class="kw">const</span> suffix <span class="op">=</span> <span class="st">&#39;&lt;/span&gt;&#39;</span><span class="op">:</span> <span class="at">console</span>(<span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;string&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">-1</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>(nPrefix<span class="op">,</span> suffix<span class="op">,</span> pPrefix<span class="op">,</span> suffix))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">// logs &quot;&lt;span class=&quot;negative&quot;&gt;r&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;negative&quot;&gt;t&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;negative&quot;&gt;s&lt;/span&gt;&quot;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="negatablestring.prototype.consoleiterator">NegatableString.prototype.consoleIterator();</h3> <p>Some consoles (Chrome, Deno, but not currently node) have log methods that allow styling accepting as their first argument a specifically formatted string; and as their subsequent arguements, style parameters.</p> <p>The &quot;consoleIterator&quot; method takes advantage of this. It produces an object that can be destructured into a call to console.log that will produced a result with characters colored according to their parity.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(...<span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;rts&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">-1</span>).<span class="at">consoleIterator</span>(<span class="st">&quot;red&quot;</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">// logs red &quot;rts&quot; on chrome and deno</span> <span class="co">// logs unformatted &quot;rts&quot; on node</span></code></pre></div> <p>Complex example multipe strings with consoleIterator;</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="kw">const</span> HELLO <span class="op">=</span> <span class="st">&quot;HELLO&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> GOODBYE <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;HELLO&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">-1</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> COMBO <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">concat</span>(HELLO<span class="op">,</span> GOODBYE)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> [string0<span class="op">,</span> ...<span class="at">colors0</span>] <span class="op">=</span> <span class="va">HELLO</span>.<span class="at">consoleIterator</span>()<span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> [string1<span class="op">,</span> ...<span class="at">colors1</span>] <span class="op">=</span> <span class="va">GOODBYE</span>.<span class="at">consoleIterator</span>()<span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> [string2<span class="op">,</span> ...<span class="at">colors2</span>] <span class="op">=</span> <span class="va">COMBO</span>.<span class="at">consoleIterator</span>()<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(...<span class="va">HELLO</span>.<span class="at">consoleIterator</span>())<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(...<span class="va">GOODBYE</span>.<span class="at">consoleIterator</span>())<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(...<span class="va">COMBO</span>.<span class="at">consoleIterator</span>())<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>( <span class="vs">`(&quot;</span><span class="sc">${</span>string0<span class="sc">}</span><span class="vs">&quot; + &quot;</span><span class="sc">${</span>string1<span class="sc">}</span><span class="vs">&quot;) = &quot;</span><span class="sc">${</span>string2<span class="sc">}</span><span class="vs">&quot;`</span><span class="op">,</span> ...<span class="at">colors0</span><span class="op">,</span> ...<span class="at">colors1</span><span class="op">,</span> ...<span class="at">colors2</span> )<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">// logs &quot;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="concat">concat</h3> <p>Concatenating string with negative characters is where the magic happens.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> concat <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="at">concat</span>(<span class="st">&quot;hello&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;hello&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">-1</span>)).<span class="at">toString</span>())<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//logs &quot;&quot;</span> <span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>( <span class="at">concat</span>(<span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;http://&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">-1</span>)<span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;https://iamjohnhenry.com&quot;</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>() )<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//logs &quot;https://iamjohnhenry.com&quot;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="negater">negater</h3> <p>You may want to construct string where not all characters are negative or positive.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> negater <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="at">negater</span>(<span class="st">&quot;mi~ss~issippi&quot;</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>(<span class="st">&quot;~&quot;</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//logs &quot;mssippi&quot;. Note the ~s cancelled out the s and then the i cancelled the ~i</span></code></pre></div> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="at">negater</span>(<span class="st">&quot;mi~ss~issippi&quot;</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>(<span class="st">&quot;~&quot;</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//logs &quot;mssippi&quot;. Note the ~s cancelled out the s and then the i cancelled the ~i</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="equals">equals</h3> <p>Test if two strings represent the exact same charcters, in the same order, with the same parity</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> equal <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="at">equal</span>(<span class="st">&quot;alpha&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;alpha&quot;</span>)))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">// true</span> <span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="at">equal</span>(<span class="st">&quot;beta&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="at">scale</span>(<span class="st">&quot;beta&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">-1</span>)))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//false</span></code></pre></div> </body> </html>

title: liedenticon
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="liedenticon">Liedenticon</h1> <p>Transform a string into a unique image.</p> <h2 id="liedenticon-vs-identicon">Liedenticon vs Identicon</h2> <p>Liedenticon is a <del>ripoff of</del> refinement of <a href="https://github.com/stewartlord/identicon.js/tree/master">Identicon</a> with a few major differences.</p> <h3 id="modules">Modules</h3> <p>Liedenticons separates image generation into two separate classes. One to generate SVGs and another to generate PNGs.</p> <h4 id="common-js-module">Common JS Module</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="kw">const</span> <span class="op">{</span> SVG<span class="op">,</span> PNG <span class="op">}</span> <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">require</span>(<span class="st">&quot;liedenticons&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="es6-module">ES6 Module</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> SVG<span class="op">,</span> PNG <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;liedenticon/js&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="es6-module-1">ES6 Module</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;script</span><span class="ot"> src=</span><span class="st">&quot;../vendor/liedenticon/browser.js&quot;</span><span class="kw">&gt;&lt;/script&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;script&gt;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> <span class="op">{</span> SVG<span class="op">,</span> PNG <span class="op">}</span> <span class="op">=</span> <span class="va">window</span>.<span class="at">Liedenticons</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;/script&gt;</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="svg-class">SVG Class</h4> <p>By default the SVG module will generate an svg string to be embedded in a document.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">SVG</span>(<span class="st">&quot;...&quot;</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//logs &quot;&lt;svg ...&quot;</span></code></pre></div> <p>Passing a truthy paramater to the &quot;toString&quot; method will create a string that can be used directly as the source attribute of an image.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">SVG</span>(<span class="st">&quot;...&quot;</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>(<span class="kw">true</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//logs &quot;data:image/svg+xml;utf8,&lt;svg ...&quot;</span></code></pre></div> <p>Passing a second truthy paramater returns the base 64 encoded string.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">SVG</span>(<span class="st">&quot;...&quot;</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>(<span class="kw">true</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="kw">true</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//logs &quot;data:image/svg+xml;base64,...&quot;</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="png-moduclassle">PNG ModuClassle</h4> <p>The PNG module will generate a base64 string by default with a preamble attached.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">SVG</span>(<span class="st">&quot;...&quot;</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//logs &quot;data:image/svg+png;base64,...&quot;</span></code></pre></div> <p>Passing a falsy parameter to &quot;toString&quot; method will drop the preamble.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">SVG</span>(<span class="st">&quot;...&quot;</span>).<span class="at">toString</span>(<span class="kw">false</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//logs &quot;...&quot;</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="future">Future</h4> <p>Both the SVG and PNG modules both inherit from an internal class called Graphic. It should be easy to extend this object and support other fomats by implementing a &quot;renderImage&quot; and a &quot;toString&quot; method.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> Graphics <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;liedenticon/graphic&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">class</span> NewFormat <span class="kw">extends</span> Graphics <span class="op">{</span> <span class="at">renderImage</span>(hash<span class="op">,</span> size<span class="op">,</span> padding<span class="op">,</span> background<span class="op">,</span> foreground) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">//...</span> <span class="op">}</span> <span class="at">toString</span>() <span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">//...</span> <span class="op">}</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="color-support">Color Support</h3> <p>In addition to using an array for colors, Liedenticons supports 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 digit hex color codes. 2, 4, and 8 digit colors support alpha channels</p> <h3 id="padding-vs-margin">Padding vs Margin</h3> <p>We've replaced the &quot;margin&quot; option &quot;padding&quot; as it this more closely fits this <a href="https://www.w3schools.com/cSS/css_padding.asp">definition</a> used by most web developers.</p> <h4 id="padding-percentage">Padding Percentage</h4> <p>Padding also supports values given as percentage strings.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="kw">const</span> svg <span class="op">=</span> <span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">SVG</span>(<span class="st">&quot;...&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="op">{</span> <span class="dt">padding</span><span class="op">:</span> <span class="st">&quot;20%&quot;</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="classes">Classes</h2> <dl> <dt> <a href="#SVG">SVG</a>  <code>liedenticon/graphic</code> </dt> <dd> </dd> <dt> <a href="#PNG">PNG</a>  <code>liedenticon/graphic</code> </dt> <dd> </dd> </dl> <p><a name="SVG"></a></p> <h2 id="svg-liedenticongraphic">SVG  <code>liedenticon/graphic</code></h2> <p><strong>Kind</strong>: global class<br /> <strong>Extends</strong>: <code>liedenticon/graphic</code><br /> <a name="new_SVG_new"></a></p> <h3 id="new-svghash-options">new SVG(hash, options)</h3> <p>A hash represented as an SVG</p> <table> <thead> <tr class="header"> <th>Param</th> <th>Type</th> <th>Description</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr class="odd"> <td>hash</td> <td><code>string</code></td> <td>unique string</td> </tr> <tr class="even"> <td>options</td> <td><code>object</code></td> <td>graphicical options</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <p><strong>Example</strong></p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode js"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> SVG <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;Liedenticons&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> svg <span class="op">=</span> <span class="va">document</span>.<span class="at">createElement</span>(<span class="st">&quot;SVG&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">document</span>.<span class="at">appendChild</span>(svg)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">svg</span>.<span class="at">outerHTML</span> <span class="op">=</span> <span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">SVG</span>(<span class="st">&quot;efb8c90a13f7a1fdc4910&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <p><a name="PNG"></a></p> <h2 id="png-liedenticongraphic">PNG  <code>liedenticon/graphic</code></h2> <p><strong>Kind</strong>: global class<br /> <strong>Extends</strong>: <code>liedenticon/graphic</code><br /> <a name="new_PNG_new"></a></p> <h3 id="new-pnghash-options">new PNG(hash, options)</h3> <p>A hash represented as an PNG</p> <table> <thead> <tr class="header"> <th>Param</th> <th>Type</th> <th>Description</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr class="odd"> <td>hash</td> <td><code>string</code></td> <td>unique string</td> </tr> <tr class="even"> <td>options</td> <td><code>object</code></td> <td>graphicical options</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <p><strong>Example</strong></p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode js"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> PNG <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;Liedenticons&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> img <span class="op">=</span> <span class="va">document</span>.<span class="at">createElement</span>(<span class="st">&quot;IMG&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">img</span>.<span class="at">src</span> <span class="op">=</span> <span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">PNG</span>(<span class="st">&quot;efb8c90a13f7a1fdc4910&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">document</span>.<span class="at">appendChild</span>(img)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> </body> </html>

title: tester
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="tester">Tester</h1> <p>../js/tester@latest/index.mjs</p> <p>Tester is a javascript testing framework based on <a href="https://github.com/substack/tape">Tape</a>.</p> <p>Like Tape, tester</p> <ul> <li>can be run directly using <a href="https://nodejs.org">node</a> without any additional binaries or transformations.</li> <li>produces output using the standard <a href="https://testanything.org/">Test Anything Protocol</a>.</li> </ul> <p>Unlike Tape, tester</p> <ul> <li>can be run directly in the browser or using <a href="https://deno.land">deno</a> without any additional binaries/transformations, along with node.</li> <li>uses external assertions and makes it easy to write your own.</li> </ul> <h2 id="api">API</h2> <p>Tester's API consist of two manin components:</p> <ul> <li>The &quot;tester&quot; function acts on a group of assertions.</li> <li>The assertions themselves, which return errors if a given condition is not satisfied.</li> </ul> <h3 id="tester-1">Tester</h3> <p>The tester function is the default export.</p> <p>It takes as its only argument a [possibly asynchronous] generator. We call this a &quot;test&quot;.</p> <p>Results of assertions are yielded from within the body of a test.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> tester <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="at">tester</span>(<span class="kw">function</span><span class="op">*</span> () <span class="op">{</span> <span class="kw">yield</span> <span class="co">/*some assertion result*/</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">yield</span> <span class="co">/*some other assertion result*/</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="assertions">Assertions</h3> <p>The named exports are assertions.</p> <p>Call them within a test and yield their results.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> tester<span class="op">,</span> <span class="op">{</span> ok<span class="op">,</span> notok <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="at">tester</span>(<span class="kw">function</span><span class="op">*</span> () <span class="op">{</span> <span class="kw">yield</span> <span class="at">ok</span>(<span class="kw">true</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">yield</span> <span class="at">notok</span>(<span class="kw">false</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="included-assertions">Included Assertions</h4> <p>Besides ok and notok, there are a number of assertions included:</p> <ul> <li>ok -- test passes if and only if the given argument to a test is TRUTHY.</li> <li>notok -- test passes if and only if the given argument to a test is FALSH.</li> <li>equal -- test passes if and only if the two given arguments are THE SAME object.</li> <li>notequal -- test passes if and only if the two given arguments are NOT THE SAME object.</li> <li>pass -- test ALWAYS PASSES</li> <li>fail -- test ALWAYS FAILS</li> <li>subtestpass -- test passes if and only if the given argument is a test in which ALL THE ASSERTIONS PASS.</li> <li>subtestfail -- test passes if and only if the given argument is a test in which AT LEAST ONE ASSERTION FAILS.</li> <li>throws -- test passes if and only if the given function THROWS AN ERROR when called</li> <li>doesnotthrow -- test passes if and only if the given function DOES NOT THROW AN ERROR when called</li> </ul> <h3 id="plan">plan</h3> <p>When using the run function, the first argument passed to given generator is a function. We'll call it &quot;plan&quot;, but you can name it anyting you like (&quot;expect&quot;, &quot;assertions&quot;, etc.) When <em>plan</em> is called with an integer, it dictates the number of expected assertions in a given test function.</p> <p>import tester, { ok } from &quot;./index.mjs&quot;;</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="at">tester</span>(<span class="kw">function</span><span class="op">*</span> (plan) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="at">plan</span>(<span class="dv">1</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">yield</span> <span class="at">ok</span>(<span class="kw">true</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="creating-assertions">Creating Assertions</h2> <p>When creating assertions, use the examples in <em>./assertions</em> for inspiration. Here are a few things to keep in mind:</p> <ul> <li>Assertions are functions that test for a desired conditon.</li> <li>If the given conditions meet the desired conditions,</li> <li>an accepted message is returned.</li> <li>Otherwise, an instance of TestError is returned.</li> </ul> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> TestError <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./testerror.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> assertion <span class="op">=</span> (<span class="co">/*given conditions*/</span>)<span class="op">=&gt;{</span> <span class="cf">if</span>(<span class="co">/*conditions are met*/</span>)<span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">return</span> <span class="co">/*some message*/</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span> <span class="cf">return</span> <span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">TestError</span>(<span class="co">/*some message*/</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="conventions">Conventions</h3> <p>This library follows a specific convetion for its assertions. It's recommended that you follow these conventions when creating your own assertions, but feel free to come up with your own.</p> <ul> <li>The last item is an <em>operator string</em>, which is used for the TAP protocol and can be overridden.</li> <li>The next-to-last item is a <em>default expected message</em> that can also be overridden.</li> <li>The preceeding arguments are given conditions to be tested.</li> <li>The returned TestError is constructed using the default expected message along with an object detailing the difference between what's expected and what's not.</li> </ul> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> TestError <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./testerror.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> assertion <span class="op">=</span> (<span class="co">/*given conditions*/</span><span class="op">,</span> message<span class="op">,</span> operatorString)<span class="op">=&gt;{</span> <span class="cf">if</span>(<span class="co">/*conditions are met*/</span>)<span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">return</span> message<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span> <span class="cf">return</span> <span class="kw">new</span> <span class="at">TestError</span>(message<span class="op">,</span> <span class="co">/*some object*/</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="testerror-api">TestError API</h3> <p>The test error is constructed with two items:</p> <ul> <li>An expected messages</li> <li>An object who's key-value pairs are displayed as part of TAP output</li> </ul> <h1 id="tester-2">Tester</h1> <p>A context-independent testing framework inspired by <a href="https://github.com/substack/tape">tape</a>.</p> <h2 id="context-agnostic">context-agnostic</h2> <p>Tests run in same context as your application. No special executables needed.</p> <h2 id="tap-output">TAP Output</h2> <p>Tester outputs to the console using a partial implementation of the <a href="https://testanything.org/tap-specification.html">Test Anything Protocol</a>.</p> <h2 id="usage">Usage</h2> <p>The default export of ./index.mjs is an asynchronous function, <em>tester</em>, that takes a test in the form of an asynchronous iterator.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> tester <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> await <span class="at">tester</span>(async <span class="kw">function</span><span class="op">*</span> () <span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">/* define test here s*/</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="title">Title</h3> <p>Optionally <em>tester</em> takes a string as it's first argument. This will be printed out before each test.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> tester <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> await <span class="at">tester</span>(<span class="st">&quot;test title&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> async <span class="kw">function</span><span class="op">*</span> () <span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">/* define test here s*/</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="definition-and-format">Definition and format</h3> <p>When creating a test, simply yield the result of an assertion.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> tester <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="im">import</span> ok <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./assertions/ok.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> await <span class="at">tester</span>(<span class="st">&quot;test title&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> async <span class="kw">function</span><span class="op">*</span> () <span class="op">{</span> <span class="kw">yield</span> <span class="at">ok</span>(<span class="kw">true</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <p>There are 7 built in assertions included alongside the default export for convinience.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> tester<span class="op">,</span> <span class="op">{</span> ok<span class="op">,</span> notok<span class="op">,</span> equal<span class="op">,</span> notequal<span class="op">,</span> deepequal<span class="op">,</span> pass<span class="op">,</span> fail<span class="op">,</span> <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="with-plan-argument">with plan argument</h3> <p>The first argument to the test is a <em>plan</em> function which is used to announce then number of tests before they take place via TAP.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> tester <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="im">import</span> ok <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./assertions/ok.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> await <span class="at">tester</span>(<span class="st">&quot;test title&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> async <span class="kw">function</span><span class="op">*</span> (plan) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="at">plan</span>(<span class="dv">1</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">yield</span> <span class="at">ok</span>(<span class="kw">true</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="assetions">assetions</h2> <p>Assertions are functions. They take any number of arguments and return either a success message string or an instance of TestError (&quot;/testerror.mjs&quot;).</p> <h3 id="included-assertions-1">included assertions</h3> <h4 id="ok">ok</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> ok <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;/index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">ok</span>(<span class="kw">true</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="cf">if</span> (result <span class="kw">instanceof</span> Error) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">throw</span> result<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="notok">notok</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> notok <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;/index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">notok</span>(<span class="kw">false</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="cf">if</span> (result <span class="kw">instanceof</span> Error) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">throw</span> result<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="equal">equal</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> equal <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;/index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">equal</span>(<span class="kw">true</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="kw">true</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="cf">if</span> (result <span class="kw">instanceof</span> Error) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">throw</span> result<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="notequal">notequal</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> notequal <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">notequal</span>(<span class="kw">true</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="kw">false</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="cf">if</span> (result <span class="kw">instanceof</span> Error) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">throw</span> result<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="deepequal">deepequal</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> deepequal <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">deepequal</span>(<span class="op">{</span> <span class="dt">a</span><span class="op">:</span> <span class="kw">true</span> <span class="op">},</span> <span class="op">{</span> <span class="dt">a</span><span class="op">:</span> <span class="kw">true</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="cf">if</span> (result <span class="kw">instanceof</span> Error) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">throw</span> result<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="pass">pass</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> pass <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">pass</span>()<span class="op">;</span> <span class="cf">if</span> (result <span class="kw">instanceof</span> Error) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">throw</span> result<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="fail">fail</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> fail <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">fail</span>()<span class="op">;</span> <span class="cf">if</span> (result <span class="kw">instanceof</span> Error) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">throw</span> result<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="subtestpass">subtestpass</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> subtestpass<span class="op">,</span> pass <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> await <span class="at">subtestpass</span>(<span class="kw">function</span><span class="op">*</span> () <span class="op">{</span> <span class="kw">yield</span> <span class="at">pass</span>()<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="cf">if</span> (result <span class="kw">instanceof</span> Error) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">throw</span> result<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h4 id="subtestfail">subtestfail</h4> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> subtestfail<span class="op">,</span> fail <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./index.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> result <span class="op">=</span> await <span class="at">subtestfail</span>(<span class="kw">function</span><span class="op">*</span> () <span class="op">{</span> <span class="kw">yield</span> <span class="at">fail</span>()<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="cf">if</span> (result <span class="kw">instanceof</span> Error) <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">throw</span> result<span class="op">;</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="creating-external-assertions">creating external assertions</h3> <p>Assertions have the following general form:</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">export</span> <span class="im">default</span> (...<span class="at">args</span>) <span class="op">=&gt;</span> <span class="op">{</span> <span class="cf">if</span>(<span class="co">/*test of args passes*/</span>)<span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">// return a string to indicate success.</span> <span class="op">}</span> <span class="cf">else</span> <span class="op">{</span> <span class="co">// return instance of TestError</span> <span class="op">}</span> <span class="op">}</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="taprunner-print-run">TAPRunner, print, run</h2> <p>The file &quot;/TAPRunner.mjs&quot; export methods &quot;print&quot; and &quot;run&quot;. &quot;print&quot; functions similarly to the default export of &quot;index.mjs&quot; -- both of which rely on &quot;run&quot; to execute underlying code.</p> <p>When called with as single argument (a test), &quot;run&quot; yields only the results of the test (string or Error) without additional processing.</p> </body> </html>

title: simple-element
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="textelement">textElement</h1> <p>Create HTML Components using simple HTML Text strings.</p> <h2 id="creating-elements">Creating elements</h2> <ul> <li>The module provides two exports: <em>shadowOpen</em> and <em>shadowClosed</em>.</li> <li>Pass an HTML string to either to create an element derived from <em>globalThis.HTMLElement</em>.</li> <li>Use the resulting class as the second argument to <em>globalThis.customElements.define</em>.</li> <li>Each can be used as a regular function or as a <a href="https://2ality.com/2016/11/computing-tag-functions.html">tag function</a>.</li> </ul> <h3 id="regular-function-usage">Regular function usage</h3> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> shadowOpen <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./textElement.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> HTMLString <span class="op">=</span> <span class="st">&quot;&lt;div&gt;I am HTML&lt;/div&gt;&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> SampleElementClass <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">shadowOpen</span>(HTMLString)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">customElements</span>.<span class="at">define</span>(<span class="st">&quot;sample-element&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> SampleElementClass)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="tag-function-usage">Tag function usage</h3> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> <span class="op">{</span> shadowClosed <span class="op">}</span> <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;./textElement.mjs&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">customElements</span>.<span class="at">define</span>( <span class="st">&quot;sample-element&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> shadowClosed<span class="vs">`&lt;div&gt;I am HTML&lt;/div&gt;`</span> )<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="shadowopen-vs-shadowclosed">shadowOpen vs shadowClosed</h3> <p><em>shadowOpen</em> creates an element with an accessible shadowRoot.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">customElements</span>.<span class="at">define</span>( <span class="st">&quot;open-element&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> shadowOpen<span class="vs">`&lt;div&gt;I am open&lt;/div&gt;`</span> )<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//...</span> <span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>( <span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">document</span>.<span class="at">getElementsByTagName</span>(<span class="st">&quot;open-element&quot;</span>)[<span class="dv">0</span>].<span class="at">shadowRoot</span> )<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//Logs element</span></code></pre></div> <p><em>shadowClosed</em> creates an element with an inaccessible shadowRoot.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">customElements</span>.<span class="at">define</span>( <span class="st">&quot;closed-element&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> shadowClosed<span class="vs">`&lt;div&gt;I am open&lt;/div&gt;`</span> )<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//...</span> <span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>( <span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">document</span>.<span class="at">getElementsByTagName</span>(<span class="st">&quot;closed-element&quot;</span>)[<span class="dv">0</span>].<span class="at">shadowRoot</span> )<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">//Logs null</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="composing-elements">Composing elements</h2> <p>Use the <em>slot</em> element within the HTML string to allow for other HTML elements to be embedded.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">customElements</span>.<span class="at">define</span>( <span class="st">&quot;composable-element&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> shadowOpen<span class="vs">`&lt;div&gt;&lt;slot /&gt;&lt;/div&gt;`</span> )<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;composable-element&gt;</span> I&#39;m dynamic content <span class="kw">&lt;/composable-element&gt;</span></code></pre></div> <p>Renders like:</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;div&gt;</span>I&#39;m dynamic content<span class="kw">&lt;/div&gt;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="named-slots">Named Slots</h3> <p>Used named slots to place multiple pieces content within an element.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">customElements</span>.<span class="at">define</span>( <span class="st">&quot;composable-element&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> shadowOpen<span class="vs">`&lt;slot name=&quot;first&quot; /&gt;&lt;slot name=&quot;second&quot; /&gt;`</span> )<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;composable-element&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;span</span><span class="ot"> slot=</span><span class="st">&quot;second&quot;</span><span class="kw">&gt;</span>2nd<span class="kw">&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;span</span><span class="ot"> slot=</span><span class="st">&quot;first&quot;</span><span class="kw">&gt;</span>1st<span class="kw">&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;/composable-element&gt;</span></code></pre></div> <p>Renders like:</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;div&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;span&gt;</span>1st<span class="kw">&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;br</span> <span class="kw">/&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;span&gt;</span>2nd<span class="kw">&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;/div&gt;</span></code></pre></div> <h2 id="styling-elements">Styling Elements</h2> <p>Elements can be styled by adding a <em>style</em> tag to the HTML string.</p> <p>Because the style tag exists within the shadowRoot, styles will only be applied within the element.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="kw">const</span> RedTextClass <span class="op">=</span> shadowOpen<span class="vs">`&lt;style&gt;*{color:red}&lt;/style&gt;&lt;slot /&gt;`</span><span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="styling-slotted-elements">Styling slotted elements</h3> <p>Slotted elements exist outside of the shadowRoot and can be styled outside of the element.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">customElements</span>.<span class="at">define</span>(<span class="st">&quot;red-element&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> RedTextClass)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;style&gt;</span> <span class="fu">.blue</span> { <span class="kw">color</span>: <span class="dv">blue</span>; } <span class="kw">&lt;/style&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;red-element&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;span</span><span class="ot"> class=</span><span class="st">&quot;blue&quot;</span><span class="kw">&gt;</span>This text is blue<span class="kw">&lt;/span&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;/red-element&gt;</span></code></pre></div> <h3 id="using-part-sudo-element">Using ::part() sudo-element</h3> <p>Parts of the element intended to be the target of external styles can be marked with the <em>part</em> attribute.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="va">globalThis</span>.<span class="va">customElements</span>.<span class="at">define</span>(<span class="st">&#39;stylable-element&#39;</span><span class="op">,</span> shadowOpen<span class="vs">`&lt;div part=content&gt; I&#39;m stylable externally&lt;/div&gt;`</span><span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode html"><code class="sourceCode html"><span class="kw">&lt;style&gt;</span> stylable-element<span class="in">::</span>part(content) { <span class="kw">color</span>: <span class="dv">blue</span>; } <span class="kw">&lt;/style&gt;</span> <span class="kw">&lt;stylable-element</span> <span class="kw">/&gt;</span></code></pre></div> </body> </html>

title: returnTimeout
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h2 id="returntimeout">returnTimeout</h2> <p><code>returnTimeout</code> has a similar API to set the built-in <code>setTimeout</code> function. Instead of returning and ID of a timeout, it returns a promise fulfilled with the value of the function when called.</p> <p>Note: there is currently no official way to cancel a promise in javascript.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> returnTimeout <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;..&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> joinStrs <span class="op">=</span> (...<span class="at">str</span>) <span class="op">=&gt;</span> <span class="va">str</span>.<span class="at">join</span>(<span class="st">&quot; &quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(await <span class="at">returnTimeout</span>(joinStrs<span class="op">,</span> <span class="dv">4500</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;hello&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;world&quot;</span>))<span class="op">;</span> <span class="co">// logs hello world after 4.5 seconds</span></code></pre></div> </body> </html>

title: consent-buddy
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="consent-buddy">Consent Buddy</h1> <p>Consent buddy provides a mechanism to:</p> <ul> <li>accept a user's response to a request for consent and via prompt (via DOM events)</li> <li>handle said response (generically)</li> <li>handle visibility of said dialog (via css custom property)</li> <li>record and replay the response without re-promppting the user (via local storage)</li> </ul> </body> </html>

title: mod
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="mod">mod</h1> <p>The modulus operator (%') in math works slightly differently than it does in javascript (%). That is in math, it's a binary operation that returns a positive number. In javascript, the number can be negative. This &quot;mod&quot; function works <em>more</em> like the math version.</p> <p>mod = (a, b) =&gt; a %' b</p> </body> </html>

title: localstorage-cycler
content: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <title>John Henry</title> <link rel="canonical" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/" /> <meta name="description" content="John Henry's Person Portfolio and Blog" /> <meta name="robots" content="index,follow" /> <meta name="theme-color" content="#343233" /> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /> <meta charset="utf-8" /> <meta name="keywords" content="fun,math,engineering,science,experiments,programming" /> <meta name="author" content="John Henry" /> <link rel="icon" href="https://johnhenry.github.io/image/iajh.png" type="image/png" /> </head> <body><h1 id="localstorage-cycler">LocalStorage Cycler</h1> <p>Cycle local storage values through a given list of strings</p> <h2 id="usage">Usage</h2> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="im">import</span> localStorageCycler <span class="im">from</span> <span class="st">&quot;?&quot;</span><span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> updateLocalStorage <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">localStorageCycler</span>(<span class="st">&quot;my-key&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;a&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;b&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;c&quot;</span>)<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <p>The call to &quot;localStorageCycler&quot; checks for the existence of the key (&quot;my-key&quot;) in localStorage. and sets it to the first key (&quot;a&quot;) if not already set.</p> <p>When called, the &quot;updateLocalStorage&quot; function cycles the value associated with the key in localStorage through the given values (&quot;a&quot;, &quot;b&quot;, and &quot;c&quot;).</p> <p>The &quot;updateLocalStorage&quot; returns an object with the following keys:</p> <ul> <li>key - the associated local storage key</li> <li>value - the current value of the local storage item</li> <li>index - the current index of the local storage item</li> <li>result - the reuslt of an handler, if passed (see below)</li> </ul> <h2 id="change-handler">Change Handler</h2> <p>To react to the change, pass a optional change handler as the second parameter to &quot;localStorageCycler&quot;.</p> <div class="sourceCode"><pre class="sourceCode javascript"><code class="sourceCode javascript"><span class="kw">const</span> onChange <span class="op">=</span> (<span class="op">{</span> value<span class="op">,</span> key<span class="op">,</span> index<span class="op">,</span> events <span class="op">}</span>) <span class="op">=&gt;</span> <span class="va">console</span>.<span class="at">log</span>(<span class="op">{</span> value<span class="op">,</span> key<span class="op">,</span> index<span class="op">,</span> events <span class="op">}</span>)<span class="op">;</span> <span class="kw">const</span> updateLocalStorage <span class="op">=</span> <span class="at">localStorageCycler</span>( <span class="st">&quot;my-key&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> onChange<span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;a&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;b&quot;</span><span class="op">,</span> <span class="st">&quot;c&quot;</span> )<span class="op">;</span></code></pre></div> <p>The handler takes four parametes:</p> <ul> <li><p>the same, &quot;key&quot;, &quot;value&quot;, and &quot;index&quot; parameters returned from calling &quot;updateLocalStorage&quot;</p></li> <li><p>an &quot;events&quot; parameter -- an array of everything passed into the &quot;updateLocalStorage&quot; function OR an &quot;init&quot; CustomEvent if fired from the initial call to localStorageCycler.</p></li> </ul> </body> </html>
